This function allows you to pin an app on your device screen so that you cannot navigate away from it.
While an app is pinned, notifications from other apps will be blocked and other functions, such as calling and messaging, may not be available.

"While an app is pinned, notifications from other apps will be blocked. Other functions may also not be available. For example, your ringtone will not sound, you will not be able to answer phone calls, and your location information will not be available to others."
While an app is pinned, notifications will be blocked and other functions may not be available.
To unpin an app, press and hold the Recents and Back keys at the same time.
To unpin an app, press and hold the Menu and Back keys at the same time.
To unpin application, press and hold the recents key.
To unpin application, press and hold the menu key.
To unpin an app, touch and hold the Recents and Back buttons at the same time.
To unpin the app, touch and hold Recents button.
This app does not support Pin windows.
Unable to pin app. %s closed. Unknown error occurred.

To see available networks, turn on Wi-Fi.
"Using high brightness levels for long periods may cause eye strain and increase battery consumption. Tap OK to allow the brightness to be increased above safe levels."
Unable to enable Ultra data saving mode while in Flight mode. Disable Flight mode and try again.

Enable this mode to filter all incoming calls. You will only be notified about the urgent calls while you are driving. You will not be able to use your device while driving. You can also view calls that were missed while S bike mode was enabled, send automatic text messages containing your estimated journey time to selected contacts when they call, view travel information, and earn badges.
Drag buttons to the area above to add them to the quick settings panel.

Insert a SIM card to use Mobile Hotspot and other tethering options.
"Please install a SIM card in order to share your phone's data connection with other devices using Mobile Wi-Fi HotSpot or USB tethering for Internet access."
"Please install a SIM card in order to share your phone's data connection with other devices using Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot or USB tethering for Internet access."
Insert a SIM card to use Mobile Hotspot and other tethering options.
Insert a SIM card to use Wi-Fi tethering.

Mobile Hotspot and Smart View cannot be turned on at the same time. Smart View will be turned off.
Mobile Hotspot and Smart View cannot be turned on at the same time. Smart View will be turned off.
Mobile HotSpot and Smart View cannot be turned on at the same time. Smart View will be turned off.

Hotspot and Smart View cannot be turned on at the same time. Smart View will be turned off.
"Wi-Fi tethering and Smart View can't be turned on at the same time. Smart View will be turned off."

"Your Wi-Fi network may be shared with other devices. Be aware that your device may switch between your saved Wi-Fi networks without notice. You are responsible for complying with all of your Wi-Fi provider's terms and conditions."

Your location information might be sent to your service provider while you are using Wi-Fi calling. Contact your service provider for details.
Your location-related information can be sent to Google and your operator in order to establish Wi-Fi calls, whether or not you have activated the location feature.

Wi-Fi calling needs to use your location information. Location will be enabled. Anonymous location data will be collected and sent to Google and your service provider. Contact your service provider for details.
Private mode not available in work profile.
Unable to disable Private mode while moving items to Private.
"Unless you connect to a Wi-Fi network, you won't be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a network connection."
"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that require a data connection. Turn off the mobile data connection?"

"Your phone's Video Calling function won't work when mobile data is off. Also, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi. Turn off the mobile data connection?"

"Your tablet's Video Calling function won't work when mobile data is off. Also, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi. Turn off the mobile data connection?"
Mobile data (WCDMA/LTE) will be turned off. Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use apps that require a data connection. You can still send and receive multimedia messages.

"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."
Mobile data (WCDMA/LTE) will be turned off. Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use apps that require a data connection. You can still send and receive multimedia messages.

"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."

"If Mobile data is turned off, your device must be connected to a Wi-Fi network to use services that require a network connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

Data roaming may incur additional charges in addition to your domestic flat rate plan. Automatic updates for email or applications may also incur additional charges. Using large-data services such as video or email may incur charges over 20,000 won per minute.
Unable to turn Mobile data on or off while Advanced calling enabled.
Unable to turn on Flashlight. Battery power low.
Battery power low. Flashlight will be turned off.
AT&T Video Call won’t work if mobile data is off. Also, you won’t be able to use the internet, email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi.

"Your phone can share its approximate location with apps and services like maps, shopping and weather.
Apps and services that use your location should inform you. Read the privacy policy of any app or service provider you are considering to understand how they collect, use and share your location information before you use them.
Determining your location will use the mobile network. Data usage will apply."

"Your tablet can share its approximate location with apps and services like maps, shopping and weather.
Apps and services that use your location should inform you. Read the privacy policy of any app or service provider you’re considering to understand how they collect, use and share your location information before you use them.
Determining your location will use the mobile network. Data usage will apply."
GPS location and use of your location data are controlled by the applications you use.
Disabling Location will disable Wi-Fi calling.

"Any changes you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your device.
Some accounts may also automatically copy any changes you make on the device to the web. Auto sync will be enabled."

This will reduce data usage and conserve battery power, but you need to sync accounts manually to collect the most recent information. While this is enabled, you will not receive notifications about updates.

Flight mode allows you to turn off calling, messaging and data network features. It also turns off connectivity features such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. To use Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, turn them on in Settings or on the notification panel.
Flight mode allows you to turn off network features, including Wi-Fi. To use Wi-Fi, turn it on in Settings or the notification panel.
Flight mode allows you to disable calling, messaging, and mobile networks functions.

"Turn off Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.
You can turn them on again in Settings or the quick settings panel."

Flight mode allows you to turn off calling, messaging and data network features. It also turns off connectivity features such as Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. To use Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, turn them on in Settings or on the notification panel.
"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will not be able to use the Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection. Turn on Airplane mode?"
"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will not be able to use Internet, Email, Wi-Fi Calling or other apps that require a data connection. Turn on Airplane mode?"
Unable to enable Flight mode while Block power off while locked is enabled. Try again after unlocking the screen.
Flight mode disabled on demo devices.
Turn on Wi-Fi to use Wi-Fi calling.
To enable %s, detach keyboard cover from device.
Uses GPS, Wi-Fi, and mobile networks to estimate your location.
Uses Wi-Fi and mobile networks to estimate your location.
Uses GPS to estimate your location.
Uses GPS, Wi-Fi, and mobile networks to estimate your location.

"Turn off calling, messaging, and Mobile data.
Wi-Fi and Bluetooth will also be turned off, but you can turn them on again in Settings or the quick settings panel."

Airplane mode turns off all network connections, including mobile data and Wi-Fi. Your phone will not be able to use Video Calling while Airplane mode is on. Turn on Wi-Fi to use apps that require a data connection.
Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will not be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection. Your phone will not be able to use Video Calling while Airplane mode is on.
Airplane mode turns off all network connections, including mobile data and Wi-Fi. Turn on Wi-Fi to use apps that require a data connection.
Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will not be able to use the Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Access the internet through your mobile network.
Mute all calls, alerts, and media, except for your selected exceptions.
Select the orientation of the display.
"Rotate the screen automatically when your phone's orientation changes."
"Rotate the screen automatically when your tablet's orientation changes."
The camera light may cause low temperature burns when in prolonged contact with the skin. Avoid leaving %s turned on for an extended period.
The screen is optimised for reading. This mode is only available for selected applications.
Reduce eye strain by limiting the amount of blue light emitted by the screen.

"Use Wi-Fi networks to make and receive calls anywhere, without connecting to a mobile network.
The Wi-Fi calling icon will appear in the notification panel as shown below while the service is available."
%s, Button label, Double tap to view relevant quick settings.
Wi-Fi Calling lets you call and text while on a Wi-Fi Network. Usage will be deducted from the minute and text message buckets in your Wireless plan. Click below to Activate.
Please connect to a Wi-Fi network to register for Wi-Fi Calling.
Keep track of your brightness adjustments and apply them automatically in similar lighting conditions.
Adjust the screen brightness automatically based on the current lighting conditions.

You can restore your previous settings for the guest profile or use default settings.

"When you add a new user, they need to set up their own space.
Any user can update apps for all other users."
Listening at a high volume for a long time may damage your hearing. Tap OK to allow the volume to be increased above safe levels.
Listening at high volumes for a long time may damage hearing. To increase volume, open cover.
Volume cannot exceed recommended safety limit (%s) while earphones are connected in Kids Mode.
Control the media volume by default when you press the Volume keys.
To increase the volume, go to Settings and turn off Media volume limiter or change your volume limit.

"Can't change the volume on %s while media volume is muted."
Enabling Mobile hotspot will turn off Wi-Fi.
Turning on Mobile Hotspot will turn off Wi-Fi.
Mobile Hotspot uses your mobile data connection. Your Wi-Fi connection will be turned off.
Enabling Mobile hotspot will turn off WLAN.
Enabling Wi-Fi tethering will turn off Wi-Fi.

Enabling Portable WLAN hotspot will disconnect device connected via WLAN Direct.
Mobile Hotspot will be enabled. This will increase battery consumption and data usage.

To use split screen view, tap %s. Select an app to show on the bottom half of the screen.
To use split screen view, tap the Open in split screen view icon. Select an app to show on the bottom half of the screen.
You can switch an app from full screen view to split screen view by pressing and holding the Recents key.
You can switch an app from full screen view to split screen view by touching and holding the Recents button.
To use Snap window, tap %s. Select an area of the app to dock at the top of the screen before showing it in split screen view.
To use Snap window, tap the Snap window icon. Select an area of the app to dock at the top of the screen before showing it in split screen view.
"Tap %1$s on the title bar of the app window to lock apps. Locked apps won't be removed even when you tap CLOSE ALL. To unlock, tap %2$s."
"Tap the Lock icon on the title bar of the app window to lock apps. Locked apps won't be removed even when you tap CLOSE ALL. To unlock, tap the Unlock icon."
Tap %s to change the aspect ratio to full screen view.
Wi-Fi connection required. Connect to Wi-Fi network and try again.
"Your phone isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network. To use a mobile network instead, turn off Airplane mode in Settings."
"Your tablet isn't connected to a Wi-Fi network. To use a mobile network instead, turn off Airplane mode in Settings."
Connect to a Wi-Fi network or turn on Mobile data.
Mobile data is disabled. Connect to Wi-Fi network instead, or enable mobile data and try again.
Connect to a Wi-Fi network or turn on Data roaming.
The use of mobile device while you are walking or driving has a risk of accident.
"Your mobile data connection is turned off. Unless you use Wi-Fi, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that require a data connection."

"Your mobile data connection is turned off. Your phone's Video Calling function won't work when mobile data is off. Also, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi."
Network does not provide date and time information. Go to Date and time settings to set manually.
Date and time information is not updating automatically. Go to Settings > Date and time to set manually.
Select time zone before setting time.

"Unable to detect a SIM card. Your device will be unable to perform actions such as making calls and connecting to mobile networks.
To protect against water damage, make sure the SIM/SD card tray is firmly sealed."
To protect against water damage, make sure the SIM/SD card tray is firmly sealed.
Moisture has been detected. Unplug the charger and make sure both the charger and USB port are dry.

"Your device is overheating. Steps will be taken to cool it down.
You can still use your device, but: - The screen may be dimmed. - The device may slow down. - Charging may be paused.
After the device cools down, performance will return to normal automatically."
Unable to open applications. You can only use the Phone and Contacts applications.

"Your phone is getting hot, so it's taking steps to cool itself down.
You can still use it, but you may notice: - The screen might dim. - The phone might slow down. - Charging might pause.
Your phone will return to normal once it cools down."

"Your tablet is getting too hot, so it’s taking steps to cool itself down.
You can still use your tablet, but you may notice: The screen might dim. The tablet might slow down. Charging might pause.
After the tablet cools down, performance willAutomatically go back to normal."
"Your phone is getting hot. It will now turn off to cool down."
Your tablet is getting too hot. It will now turn off to cool down.
Why did my phone turn off by itself?
Why did my tablet turn off by itself?

"Your phone got hot. It turned off to prevent damage to the phone.
This can be caused by: Using graphics-intensive apps, like video games and navigation apps, for long periods of time. Downloading or uploading large files. Using your phone in a very hot location."

"Your tablet got too hot. It turned off to prevent damage to the tablet.
Overheating can be caused by: Using graphics intensive apps like video games and navigation apps for long periods of time. Downloading or uploading large files. Using your tablet in a very hot location."
Your device is overheating. It will now power off to cool down.
Your device is overheating. To cool down, it will power off in %d seconds.
You will not be able to power on the device again until it has cooled down.

"Your device overheated. It powered off to prevent damage.
Overheating can be caused by: - Using graphics-intensive apps, such as games and navigation apps, for long periods of time. - Transferring large files. - Using your device in a hot environment."
Tap here to disable Safe mode.
To disable Safe mode, your device will restart. All your apps will then be available.
Tap to turn off Safe Mode.
Do you want to restart your phone to turn off Safe Mode? All of your apps will be restored.

Charge your tablet or tap here to turn on Power saving mode.

To charge faster, use the charger and cable that were provided with this phone
To charge faster, use the charger and cable that were provided with this tablet.

Make sure your charger is properly connected.
Make sure the charger is properly connected. Use the charger that came with the device.
Make sure charger is properly connected.
Make sure there are no metallic objects, such as metallic stickers, paper clips, or straps between the charging pad and mobile device.
Your battery life has been extended.
Charge your phone or tap here to turn on Power saving mode.
Charge your tablet or tap here to turn on Power saving mode.
Unable to charge your device. Make sure you are using a Samsung compatible battery and charger and that your device is properly connected to the charger.
Unable to charge your device. Make sure you are using a Galaxy compatible battery and charger and that your device is properly connected to the charger.
"Your phone's temperature is too high. Charging will continue when the temperature returns to normal."
"Your tablet's temperature is too high. Charging will continue when the temperature returns to normal."
"Your phone's temperature is too low. Charging will continue when the temperature returns to normal."
"Your tablet's temperature is too low. Charging will continue when the temperature returns to normal."

"Charging has been stopped. Your phone's temperature is too high. Be careful when disconnecting the charger. It may be very hot.
Disconnecting and reconnecting the charger may allow charging to continue normally. If overheating persists, contact Customer Service as there may be a risk of fire or injury."

"Charging has been stopped. Your tablet's temperature is too high. Be careful when disconnecting the charger. It may be very hot.
Disconnecting and reconnecting the charger may allow charging to continue normally. If overheating persists, contact Customer Service as there may be a risk of fire or injury."

The connected charger is incompatible with this phone. To prevent damage to your phone, charging has been stopped. To continue charging, use the original charger and cable that were provided with this phone.
Unable to charge. Use the original charger.
"Your phone is charging a connected device. Disconnect the USB cable to stop charging and save your phone's battery."
"Your tablet is charging a connected device. Disconnect the USB cable to stop charging and save your tablet's battery."
To prevent this from happening again, check if the proximity sensor is blocked.

Select which apps you want to block notifications from. To allow the blocked notifications later, go to Settings, then select Notifications.

"Hongbao assistant will be enabled. This function will allow you to receive WeChat red envelopes more quickly and get notifications when they are received. A network connection is required. You can enable and disable this function via the quick settings panel."
Receive WeChat red envelopes more quickly and get notifications when they are received. Tap here to enable this function.
Specified data usage limit reached. Additional data use may incur charges from service provider.

"You've reached your specified data usage limit, so mobile data has been turned off.
If you turn mobile data back on, you may be charged for data usage by your carrier."
Unable to pin app. App locked.
Connect earphones to use UHQ upscaler.
Enhance the sound resolution of music and videos for a clearer listening experience.

"You must download the app in order to control the amount of power shared. If you connect your device to another device with Samsung's Power Sharing Cable EP-SG900 without the app, the entire battery amount will be transferred to the other device. Connect to Samsung Apps and download the application."
Plan your battery consumption to meet your needs using the features below.
Select which functions you want to enable with their default settings.
Reserve your remaining battery life for calls and messages when it falls below a set threshold. The default reserve threshold is 15%.
Extend your battery life by up to double the time.
Forward incoming calls to a selected contact or number while your device is powered off because its battery power is critically low.
Unable to enable Extend battery time. The device is still learning your usage patterns. Try again later.
"Can't turn on Reserve battery mode during calls. Reserve battery mode will turn on when the call ends."
"Wi-Fi Calling is a service of your mobile operator, Orange Polska S.A. Please read the description of the service provided by your operator:"

Wi-Fi Calling service enables you to make and receive voice calls over any Wi-Fi internet connection, even in a situation where you are outside any mobile network’s coverage. Once the service is active for your mobile number, every time you connect to a Wi-Fi network your voice calls will be performed using Wi-Fi Calling. This will be indicated to you by a dedicated icon on the notification bar.

"If your Wi-Fi connection is of poor quality or your device is outside a Wi-Fi network’s coverage, your phone will make calls using an available mobile network.
Calls you make with Wi-Fi Calling in Poland are charged in the same way as your regular mobile calls in your mobile tariff plan. Incoming calls in Poland are free of charge. If you make Wi-Fi Calling calls outside Poland your calls may be charged a price specified in your mobile tariff plan’s price list.
Notwithstanding, your Wi-Fi connections may be charged independently by the provider of your Wi-Fi connection."

"Once you press the [I ACCEPT] button and your phone connects to a Wi-Fi network, your Wi-Fi Calling service will be activated. You can disable Wi-Fi Calling at any time using the phone menu.
Detailed information about your Wi-Fi Calling service can be found at www.orange.pl/wificalling.
Please note that in order to enable your emergency calls (e.g., such as 112 calls) to be routed to the closest emergency centre suitable for your actual location, your emergency calls made while the Wi-Fi Calling service is enabled will be carried by your device through any mobile network available at a given moment. Only in cases where no mobile network is available will an emergency call be routed via the Wi-Fi Calling service. Unfortunately, in such cases we will not know your precise location and therefore your emergency call may not be routed to the emergency centre closest to your actual location."

In regard to your use of Wi-Fi Calling, we – as your personal data controller – will process your data based on the number and model of the device on which you use Wi-Fi Calling, the software used on the device, the endpoint of the network used to connect with Wi-Fi Calling (including the IP address and the country to which this IP address is attributed), and the time and duration of each call, in order to perform and settle the service, answer any complaints, and to perform any statutory obligations. We will process this data for the duration of the agreement on providing telecommunication services between you and us, and after its termination – for the period of recovery of claims and of performing other tasks defined in the provisions of law. Providing the data is voluntary, but it is necessary to use the service. You have the right to access and to rectify your data.

Please find our data: Orange Polska S.A., address: Aleje Jerozolimskie 160, 02-326 Warsaw, Poland, registered in the Register of the Entrepreneurs of District Court for the Capital City of Warsaw in Warsaw, XII Commercial Division of the National Court Register (KRS), under entry number 0000010681, NIP (tax ID) 526-02-50-995; with share capital (fully paid up) of PLN 3,937,072,437.00.

"Tapping this button hides the navigation bar. You can still use the navigation buttons by swiping up from the bottom of the screen. While the navigation bar is shown, you can tap this button again to lock it in place. On some screens, such as the Home screen, the navigation bar will always be shown. If an app doesn't behave normally while the navigation bar is hidden, lock the navigation bar in place and restart the app."
Double tap this button to hide the navigation bar.
Swipe inward from the edge of the screen near the charging port to show the navigation bar.
Double tap this button again to lock the navigation bar in place.
On some screens, such as the Home screen, the navigation bar will always be shown.
To hide this button, go to Settings > Display > Navigation bar.
